metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11579 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
dhcp.c in dhcpcd before 7.2.1 contains a 1-byte read overflow with DHO_OPTSOVERLOADED. It was discovered that dhcpcd did not properly bound certain operations. An attacker could potentially use this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-11579` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dhcpcd5 - 7.1.0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dhcpcd5 package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.1.0-2').
